product_name: MuradClarifying Gel Cleanser with Salicylic Acid
summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeHSA/FSA eligibleMurad's Clarifying Cleanser with two types of salicylic acid, purifies pores and treats acne long after rinsing for refreshed and clearer-looking skin.
details: DetailsBenefitsPowerful acne gel cleanser prevents breakouts, dissolves excess oil and purifies poresTwo types of salicylic acid treat acne fast, even after rinsingGreen Tea Extract helps soothe and calm irritationLeaves skin feeling refreshed and clarifiedKey IngredientsFree form Salicylic Acid: immediate pore clearingEncapsulated form Salicylic Acid: continuous sloughing of dead skin cells, even after rinsingGreen Tea Extract: helps soothe and calm irritationResearch ResultsClinically tested by an independent laboratory and proven safe for sensitive skin.In a 3-day clinical study:94% said it dissolves excess oil94% said it deeply cleanses skin88% said it improves skin's overall appearance85% said it leaves pores feeling clean of impuritiesItem 2642506How To UseUse AM and PM.Massage a small amount over dampened face and neck. Follow with your preferred Murad treatment or moisturizer and SPF during the day.For external use only. When using this product, skin irritation and dryness is more likely to occur if you use another topical acne medication at the same time. If irritation occurs, only use one topical medication at a time. Keep out of reach of children.IngredientsActive: Salicylic Acid 1.5%. Inactive: Water (Aqua), Sodium C14-16 Olefin Sulfonate, Cocamidopropyl Betaine, Citric Acid, Urea, Yeast Amino Acids, Trehalose, Inositol, Taurine, Betaine, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Menthol, Hydrolyzed Corn Starch Octenylsuccinate, Glycerin, PPG-26-Buteth-26, PEG-40 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, PEG-150 Distearate, Acrylates Copolymer, Cocamidopropyl Dimethylamine, Glyceryl Stearate, Tetrasodium Glutamate Diacetate, Sodium Hydroxide, Leuconostoc/Radish Root Ferment Filtrate, Potassium Sorbate, Sodium Benzoate, Benzoic Acid, Phenoxyethanol, Limonene, Fragrance (Parfum).Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Use AM and PM.Massage a small amount over dampened face and neck. Follow with your preferred Murad treatment or moisturizer and SPF during the day.For external use only. When using this product, skin irritation and dryness is more likely to occur if you use another topical acne medication at the same time. If irritation occurs, only use one topical medication at a time. Keep out of reach of children.

reviews.headline: obsessed
reviews.comments: i have struggled with cystic hormonal acne since middle school, im a sophomore in college. i have tried countless amounts of face washes for consistent anounts of time, but nothing has truly worked for me. my breakouts are mostly on my chin and cheeks, which flare up mainly around my period. i bought this product on a whim, and i couldnt be happier that i did. my face didnt purge terribly, but it took time for me to notice a difference (of course). i still have scarring to clear up, but thats a work in progress. this product feels so incredibly refreshing on my face and i feel so clean after using it. i would recommend this cleanser over and over again!

reviews.headline: the best face wash ever
reviews.comments: For months ive struggled with my acne. I work in a kitchen in front of a fryer so my skin has definitely faced the consequences. I have tried so many face washes, serums, ect. but this face wash has finally made my skin the clearest its been in years!!!

reviews.headline: Glad I got it on sale
reviews.comments: I have oily skin. When I saw this on aale, I decided to get it. I used about half the bottle. It's very thick, doesnt smell good, and dries my skin out. It also did nothing for my redness. It went in the garbage. Dont waste your money

reviews.headline: Only Cleaner I Trust
reviews.comments: Been using this cleanser for probably about 3 years now, and it always leaves my skin feeling clean and fresh. I will say if you have dry skin, maybe avoid this product

reviews.headline: Murad Acne Cleanser
reviews.comments: I never have written a review but i would like to let those know who might face similar issues. I have oily, acne prone, not so sensitive but depends on my diet. I would use this in the mornings and was trying to figure out why my eyes would get so watery. To preface, i dont rub the cleanser around my eyes and i use an eye cream at night. I used my other cleanser and i was fine. Ill use up the rest of this cleanser on my body but i wouldnt suggest on your face. It has a nice cooler affect which some people would think it feels more burning. My skin loves salicylic acid but i think its the tea tree oil and parfum being the last ingredient on the list that could be burning eyes. Hope this helps!

reviews.headline: Accidental purchase turned into regular product!!
reviews.comments: I accidentally bought this since it looks similar to the murad mattifying moisturizer I use. Well since I've been using this 2 weeks and its gotten rid of my stubborn acne I double cleanse with my cerave face wash for oily skin and then use the murad wash then follow with moisturizer. Im 24 and still struggle with hormonal and stubborn acne and this has already almost completely gotten rid of everything!!! Helloo to clear skin days and confidence< 3

reviews.headline: Not sure if it has helped with break outs
reviews.comments: Smells good lots of lather

reviews.headline: Great for Dry, Sensitive Skin
reviews.comments: Perfect balance of cleansing the skin without causing dryness like most facial cleansers

reviews.headline: It burned my face
reviews.comments: My skin is painful and super dry after using this cleanser. I have red/burned spots under my eyes

reviews.headline: Great Results - it's a keeper
reviews.comments: I purchased this for my teenage son.  He's having the typical teenage hormonal acne, but it's kind of bad. He's dealing with it on his face as well as his back. Within the first week we saw improvements. Even in the first few days, the swelling and redness were instantly soothed, and the swelling and irritation definitely went down. As he's continued to use it, we are definitely seeing results!

reviews.headline: HOLY RED HOT AND SPICY!!!
reviews.comments: it burned as I was washing and 24 hrs later  my skin is red and hurts.

reviews.headline: Yes!
reviews.comments: One day a few months ago, my skin nust decided if hated me. Ive been on the hunt for ANYTHING that would help. Its not been just a little bump here or there. Its been terrible DEEP cystic acne. All over my face and neck. I happened to see this at shme shmay shmax and omg its changed my life. My face has cleared up so good. I will continue to buy this here. Yes its pricey but i promise you its so worth it. I dont do reviews but i know theres a fellow old gal like me in the trenches

reviews.headline: Avoid the 13.5 largest size bottle.
reviews.comments: The cleanser itself is okay, it leaves your skin feeling clean and refreshed but it does tend to dry my face out and the biggest problem I had was with the largest 13.5 oz size. The pump is completely useless, you get not even a full pump out and then it is stuck in that position so your only choice is to unscrew the pump and get the cleanser off that way. Can be harsh and dry your skin especially the corners of your mouth I'd follow up with a good moisturizer. I think it is way over priced, Murad has always been super expensive.

reviews.headline: Not the best but good
reviews.comments: This product is not good if you want your makeup removed but its really good if you have a bit of acne. My skin feels fresh after every use and the effect its good. You maybe not like it by the minty aftertaste but i like it so it depends on you. Its pricey YES, worth the price? I dont think so, they are way cheaper options for the same thing but if you are looking for something a bit high end this may be good for you.

reviews.headline: EFFECTIVE
reviews.comments: My favorite cleanser! Did miracles on my acne and cystic acne! Clears skin too!!

reviews.headline: Feels like toothpaste on your skin
reviews.comments: They ruined a great formula by adding menthol, it feels like I am washing my face with toothpaste so it ruins the experience for me. I cant imagine this working for sensitive skin. If they come up with a version without the menthol I would consider repurchasing.

reviews.headline: It's a NO
reviews.comments: Changed their formula maybe?? My friends and i with different skin types all tried it and all got bad reactions on the first use. I'd stay away from it for now on

reviews.headline: Honestly my favorite fact wash
reviews.comments: Ive dealt with acne for so many years and this is the only face wash that double my acne/ breakouts, and helped control my breakouts.

reviews.headline: It's ðŸ‘ðŸ¼
reviews.comments:
So I've recently been using this cleanser pretty consistently. To be honest, I've definitely been noticing a change in my skin. I usually have sparatic little red bumps and discoloration to my face.. but lately I haven't had a lot of it. Although, I don't see too too much of a big darastic difference.. I've been cleansing with this and then building a skincare routine with other products, which could also be why there is change at all. I cleanse with this product, spray my face with mario badescu, moisturize, and then put serum in my lashes. I would recommend this if you're looking to start a routine. Consistency is key if you want a product to really work for you though. 

It's approved in my book as of right now though :)

reviews.headline: IRRITATION AND BUMPY SKIN
reviews.comments: Used this cleanser for a week until these small bumps under my skin started popping up on my entire face.  My face is not smooth like usual, I wonder how long it'll take for it to go back to normal.  I've never had such a reaction to a cleanser.

media.headline: I will not buy this EVER AGAIN.
Made me get acne all over my face
if u have horrible skin, get this
media.caption: acne's former favorite spot is clear now

media.headline: Best for acne treatment
media.caption: This is an after picture from using it.

media.headline: It's a very good product I love it

faceoff_positive.comments:
I used this product for 5-6 weeks and my face got worse, but finally I figured it out. 
Treat this cleanser like medicine, use it morning and night, rub it on your face and count to at least 20 while you do so. My theory is this: it's kinda like when you take antibiotics, but not all of them, you kill the lesser bacteria but not the big bad stuff causing it to take off and "infect" causing a bigger problem. When I was using this like 1x every other day and literally just putting on and then washing off I started to get cystic acne and more acne than I had from the start. Now I follow my above mentioned tips and the big cystic acne has been 95% healed and no new problems. 
If this cleanser makes you swell or welp up then I would definitely say it is too strong for your skin, or you may be allergic to an ingredient.
I hope this helps someone!
faceoff_positive.headline: Breaking out more? Read this.

faceoff_negative.comments:
I have been using this cleanser by Murad for many years. About a year ago, they changed the formula. It is now seems to be more watery than the version before it, you have to use more of it than before. I think that it's an expensive product as it it, and for them to change the formula so that one needs to use more is not cool. I thought maybe I had a bad batch, so I continued buying the product thinking I would get a tube of the original stuff. After 5 tubes of it, I realize they just changed their formula. The painted front of the tube also continuously sloughs off when the tube is kept in the shower. May not be a big deal to people who do not keep this in their shower, but it is to me. I do not like labels sloughing off of bottles at all. It makes my shower dirty, and I'm constantly rinsing the bottle, but more keeps coming off. I do keep the tube in a dry area of the shower also. The paint coming off the tube coincided with the new, watery formula. So Murad not only cheapened their product, they cheapened their packaging.
I will now start looking for a new product to try, one that doesn't require an excessive amount to work, and one that doesn't keep my shower dirty. Too bad, this use to be a really great product.
BTW, this stuff does not work for my 14 year old son at all. He responds much better to a cleanser with benzoyl peroxide. This stuff did work alright for me. I am a 40 yr old woman with combination skin and acne. This stuff cleared up my acne, but not my hormonal acne. That still flares up monthly.
faceoff_negative.headline: Not as good as it use to be

rollup.name: Clarifying Gel Cleanser with Salicylic Acid
